This is really my favorite game. I understand why people have a problem with this game and I usually played using modified rules when I've played in recent years. Nostalgia helps push this to the top for me because I learned to play this with my uncle when I was young.

I've played a lot of the grand strategy ancients games, including all the versions of 'Imperium Romanum' and many others. This game is just plain 'fun' and that's all there is to it.

It is simple and less cumbersome than all of the other games that I have played. Sure, these other games are more 'historical' but I'm finding that the path to victory is usually the same in ALL of these games.

By that I mean, what happens is usually two parties make a gigantic army, have one big battle where one side is annihilated and then 'that's that'. The game is virtually over.

Is that historical? Yes, often it is. The Ancient world was often like that. One big battle decided it all. "Charonea", "Guagamela", "Actium", "Pharsalus" and so on.

So, I can spend hours setting up a large scenario from "Imperium Romanum" and taking at least that long to play it and the 'decisive' point of the game is always the same. One big battle where one side is destroyed.

I find, that I can achieve almost the same results playing this game in a multi-player environment where everyone has fun.
Simply beautiful and fun
